bibl.title: Our Academic Visitor is Missing: Posidippus 89 (A-B) and ""Smart Capital"" for the Thalassocrats.
The Ptolemies, the Sea and the Nile. Studies in Waterborne Power.

bibl.note: Posidipp. 89 A.-B., as a witness of a programme of bringing well-regarded philosophers to Egypt to adorn the king's tables. However, the philosophical agenda itself was resistant to royal collectionism.
bibl.seg: Paul McKechnie, Our Academic Visitor is Missing: Posidippus 89 (A-B) and ""Smart Capital"" for the Thalassocrats.
Kostas Buraselis, Mary Stefanou & Dorothy J. Thompson (edd.), The Ptolemies, the Sea and the Nile. Studies in Waterborne Power (Cambridge, 2013) pp. 132-142.

Posidipp. 89 A.-B., as a witness of a programme of bringing well-regarded philosophers to Egypt to adorn the king's tables. However, the philosophical agenda itself was resistant to royal collectionism.
